resources.string: The Great Pyramid of Giza is the oldest and largest of the three pyramids in the Giza pyramid complex bordering what is now El Giza, Egypt. It is the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, and the only one to remain largely intact.
The Museum of Egyptian Antiquities, known commonly as the Egyptian Museum or Museum of Cairo, in Cairo, Egypt, is home to an extensive collection of ancient Egyptian antiquities.
Al-Azhar Mosque is an Egyptian mosque in Islamic Cairo. Al-Mu\'izz li-Din Allah of the Fatimid dynasty commissioned its construction for the newly established capital city in 970.
Khan el-Khalili is a major souk in the historic center of Islamic Cairo. The bazaar district is one of Cairo\'s main attractions for tourists and Egyptians alike.
The Great Mosque of Muhammad Ali Pasha or Alabaster Mosque is a mosque situated in the Citadel of Cairo in Egypt and commissioned by Muhammad Ali Pasha between 1830 and 1848.
The Museum of Islamic Art, in Cairo, Egypt, is considered one of the greatest in the world, with its exceptional collection of rare woodwork and plaster artefacts, as well as metal, ceramic, glass, …

The Manial Palace and Museum, is a former Ottoman dynasty era palace and grounds on Rhoda Island on the Nile. It is located in the Sharia Al-Saray area in the El-Manial district of southern Cairo, Egypt.
The Cairo Tower is a free-standing concrete tower located in Cairo, Egypt. At 187 m, it has been the tallest structure in Egypt and North Africa for about 50 years.

The Qalawun complex is a massive complex in Cairo, Egypt that includes a madrasa, a hospital and a mausoleum. It was built by the Sultan Al-Nasir Muhammad Ibn Qalawun in the 1280s; some thirty surviving mosques were built during his time.
The Baron Empain Palace, better known as Le Palais Hindou, is a distinctive and historic Indian-inspired mansion in Heliopolis, a suburb northeast of central Cairo, Egypt.
Al Haram, Nazlet El-Semman, Al Haram, Giza Governorate

Al Sheikh Al Marsafi, Omar Al Khayam, Zamalek, Giza Governorate
28 Haret Wesst Al Balad, Sherif, Downtown, Cairo Governorate 11121

In a stone palace on 16 hectares of gardens, this upscale hotel offering views of the Giza pyramid complex is 41 km from Cairo International Airport. Polished rooms offer Wi-Fi, flat-screens and minibars, plus sitting areas. Some have pyramid views. Suites add living areas, and tea and coffeemakers. Upgraded suites come with separate living rooms and terraces, and some feature antique decor and Persian rugs. Room service is provided 24/7. Kids age 11 and under stay at no charge with an adult. There are 4 restaurants and 2 lounges, some with ornate decor and/or pyramid views. There\'s an 18-hole golf course, an outdoor pool and a gym, plus a spa.
Kafr Nassar, Al Haram, Giza Governorate
1113 Corniche El Nil, Cairo, Cairo Governorate 11221

Opposite the Nile River, this upscale hotel is 1 km from the Egyptian Museum of Antiquities and the Cairo Opera House. The elegant rooms with fine linens and marble bathrooms also feature balconies with city or river views, plus flat-screen TVs, coffeemakers and minibars. Suites add separate sitting areas; some have formal dining rooms and access to a private lounge with free breakfast. Room service and Wi-Fi are available. There are 4 restaurants, 3 bars, 2 lounges and a pastry shop. Other amenities include a spa, a fitness center, a kids\' club and an outdoor pool.
1115 Nile Corniche, Sharkas, Cairo, Cairo Governorate 12344

In a high-rise tower overlooking the River Nile, this upscale hotel is a 10-minute walk from the Egyptian Museum. It\'s also a 12-minute walk from Tahrir Square. With classic decor and city views, the relaxed rooms offer balconies. They also have minibars, TVs and free Internet access. Upgraded rooms add Nile views and pull-out couches, while club-level rooms add lounge access. Suites offer sitting areas and/or kitchenettes. Room service is available. There are 4 restaurants, including 1 with panoramic city views. There\'s also a pub and a cafe. Other amenities include a gym, an outdoor pool and a casino.

Overlooking Nile River, this upmarket downtown hotel is 4 km from the Cairo Opera House and Abdeen Palace. The refined rooms feature free Wi-Fi, safes and balconies with river views. Upgraded rooms add marble bathrooms. Executive rooms come with access to a private lounge serving food and drinks. Suites have separate dining and living areas; some have kitchens and whirlpool tubs. Kids under 18 stay in their parents\' room at no cost. There are 4 restaurants (Asian, Mediterranean, Lebanese, and seafood), a cozy snack lounge and a cosmopolitan cocktail bar. The hotel has a 24/7 gym, an outdoor heated pool and a spa. A casino and shops are on-site.
35 Giza Bridge, Oula, Giza, Giza Governorate 12311

Overlooking the Nile River, this luxury hotel is a 7-minute walk from Giza Zoo and 13 km from The Great Pyramid at Giza. Elegant rooms and suites with marble bathrooms feature free Wi-Fi safes and views of the river. Upgraded rooms add living areas, while the suites come with floor-to-ceiling windows. Some suites have kitchens and dining areas. Room service is available 24/7. There\'s a genteel tea lounge, a sophisticated cigar bar and 3 restaurants (Italian, French and Syrian-Lebanese). Other amenities include an upscale shopping center, an outdoor pool, a spa and a gym.
3 El Thawra Council St Zamalek Downtown, Le caire, Cairo Governorate 11518

Overlooking the River Nile, this upscale hotel in the Zamalek district is a 9-minute walk from Opera metro station and 2 km from the Egyptian Museum. Relaxed rooms offer flat-screen TVs, free Wi-Fi and minibars, as well as tea and coffeemaking facilities. Club rooms include butler service and access to a private lounge. Suites add sitting areas and iPod docks; some have kitchenettes. All rooms have full or partial Nile views. There are 4 bars and 6 restaurants, including 1 set on a floating deck above the river. Other amenities include an outdoor pool and a gym, plus a spa with a hammam, a Jacuzzi and a sauna. Parking is available (fee).
